newsitem.title: LEBANON: SOLIDERE announces $20.5 mln mid-year net profit.
newsitem.headline: SOLIDERE announces $20.5 mln mid-year net profit.

text.p: Lebanon's biggest company SOLIDERE announced on Tuesday net profit of $20.5 million for the first half of 1996 compared with $12.6 million for last year's corresponding period.
SOLIDERE had announced net profit of $32.3 million for the year ending December 31, 1995.

The company rebuilding war-damaged central Beirut said in its unaudited balance sheet for the period ended June 30, 1996 published in Beirut newspapers that total assets stood at $1.68 billion compared with $1.74 billion in the same period of 1995.

SOLIDERE's A and B shares have been trading on the Beirut stock exchange since September 30 when they moved to the official bourse from the privately-operated Beirut Secondary Market where they began trading in mid-1994.
